dialogue_en: Do sand baths really feel that good? Maybe I should try it.
dialogue_jp:
砂あびって　気持ちいいのか？
俺もやってみようかな

dialogue_en: Yeah, I'd say you're lookin' pretty good. Better win the next one even if it kills you.
dialogue_jp:
この毛並みなら　いけそうだね
次のレースは死んでも勝ちな

dialogue_en: Best not to get too attached, y'know. Only makes it harder when the time comes to say goodbye.
dialogue_jp:
世話なんて　適当でいいんだよ
情が移ると別れがつらくなっちまうだろ

dialogue_en: Care for a drink?
dialogue_jp: おまえも飲むか？

dialogue_en: Check my piece. Pretty sweet, right?
dialogue_jp: 見ろよこの銃　すげえだろ

dialogue_en: The chocobo races are all you. I'm more of a Beast Battleground guy.
dialogue_jp:
俺はチョコボレースより
ビーストバトルグラウンド派だね

dialogue_en: Gotta steal another chocobo soon.
dialogue_jp: また　チョコボを盗んでこねえと

dialogue_en: Don't you go messin' up the place.
dialogue_jp: 部屋を荒らすんじゃねえぞ

dialogue_en: Gus is busy at the moment.
dialogue_jp: ゲス様は仕事中よ

dialogue_en: Everyone pay their dues in full for the month?
dialogue_jp: 今月のみかじめ料はどうなってる

dialogue_en: We're gonna do some rounds soon. Remind folks who've fallen behind.
dialogue_jp:
とどこおりなく　滞納している店も
順次回収する予定です

dialogue_en: Anyone more than three months in the hole─you make an example of 'em.
dialogue_jp:
３ヶ月以上滞納した店は
見せしめに　つぶせ

dialogue_en: Yes, sir!
dialogue_jp: 了解しました

dialogue_en: Yeah, you got 'em! Go, go!
dialogue_jp: そこだ　行け行け行け！

dialogue_en: You call that runnin', you stupid bird!?
dialogue_jp: なにしてんだ　バカチョコボ！

dialogue_en: Now's your chance! Punch 'em! Kick 'em! Crush 'em!
dialogue_jp:
そこだそこ
殴れ　蹴れ　潰せ！

dialogue_en: What're you doin'!? Run, damn you!
dialogue_jp: なにしてんだい　突っ込むんだよ！

dialogue_en: C'mon, you can't just let 'em pass you like that!
dialogue_jp: ほらそこ　嚙みつきな！

dialogue_en: I feed you greens and this is how you repay me!?
dialogue_jp:
ちょっと　野菜あげたのに
この恩知らず！

dialogue_en: I s'pose the produce here ain't all bad...
dialogue_jp: 野菜の状態は　まずまずかな

dialogue_en: I mean, compared to the stuff folks're growin' out in the grasslands, it's downright dire.
dialogue_jp:
グラスランドのとれたて野菜に比べると
しなびてるし　色味も悪いけど

dialogue_en: But hey─I ain't picky!
dialogue_jp: 砂漠で贅沢は言えないしね

dialogue_en: People around the prison've been tellin' me they give their birds sand baths to get 'em clean.
dialogue_jp:
ねえ　知ってる？
砂漠では　チョコボに砂あびをさせるんだって

dialogue_en: Wonder if it's any better for 'em than a standard brush-down. Maybe I'll give it a try with Piko!
dialogue_jp:
ブラッシングの代わりなのかな？
今度　ピコにも試してみようかな

dialogue_en: And that makes three!
dialogue_jp: これで　３つ目だね

dialogue_en: Once Piko's had his fill, he'll be ready to hit the track and win us that race!
dialogue_jp:
ピコの体調も良くなってきてるし
そろそろ　レースで戦えるんじゃないかな

dialogue_en: You think the gear Esther's got is any good? Ideally, it'd give Piko an edge and be pleasing to the eye.
dialogue_jp:
レース用のパーツって　どんなやつかな
やっぱり性能だけじゃなくて　見た目も大事だろ？

dialogue_en: Our boy's one handsome bird, y'know! We want equipment that'll accentuate his features!
dialogue_jp:
ひいき目に見ても　ピコってカッコイイからさ
ちゃんと似合うやつだったらいいんだけど

dialogue_en: You better take home that trophy, y'hear?
dialogue_jp: こんなレースで　つまずいてらんないよ

dialogue_en: Today's victory'll be our steppin' stone to the big one─the Gold Cup!
dialogue_jp:
いつか　チョコボレースの最高峰
『ゴールドカップ』に出るんだ

dialogue_en: I know Piko's ready to win it all, but are you?
dialogue_jp:
だから　クラウドも
ちゃんと腕を磨いといてよ

dialogue_en: Six is plenty. Piko'll get sluggish if he eats too much.
dialogue_jp:
これで６つ目
野菜はもう　じゅうぶんだね

dialogue_en: Let's check in with Esther.
dialogue_jp: エストのところへ戻ろう

dialogue_en: Mister Gus presents: the one, the only, Desert Rush!
dialogue_jp:
ゲス様プレゼンツ
『デザートラッシュ』ができるのはここだけ！

dialogue_en: For a limited time only, if you earn the high score, you'll get some rare greens!
dialogue_jp:
いまなら　ハイスコアを叩き出したあなたに
貴重な新鮮野菜をプレゼント！

dialogue_en: Step right up and give it a try!
dialogue_jp: どう　やってかない？

dialogue_en: Play Desert Rush?
dialogue_jp: 『デザートラッシュ』に挑戦しますか？

dialogue_en: Play a <color=yellow>standard</color> round of Desert Rush?
dialogue_jp:
【デザートラッシュ　ノーマルモード】
挑戦しますか？

dialogue_en: Play a <color=yellow>challenging</color> round of Desert Rush?
dialogue_jp:
【デザートラッシュ　ハードモード】
挑戦しますか？

dialogue_en: Yes
dialogue_jp: はい

dialogue_en: No
dialogue_jp: いいえ

dialogue_en: Select a difficulty level.
dialogue_jp: どちらのモードに挑戦しますか？

dialogue_en: Standard
dialogue_jp: ノーマルモード

dialogue_en: Challenging
dialogue_jp: ハードモード

dialogue_en: Never mind.
dialogue_jp: 挑戦しない

dialogue_en: Let off some steam today with Desert Rush!
dialogue_jp: ストレス発散に　デザートラッシュ！

dialogue_en: Don't miss out on the desert's famed pastime!
dialogue_jp: 砂漠名物　デザートラッシュだよ！

dialogue_en: Give it a try! You won't regret it!
dialogue_jp: やらなきゃそんそん　レッツ・トライ！

dialogue_en: Have a good day! Hope to see you again.
dialogue_jp: またのご利用　お待ちしてま～す！

dialogue_en: Come back...if you want a challenge.
dialogue_jp: やりたくなったら　また来てね～

dialogue_en: Aw, don't tell me you're not interested!
dialogue_jp: ええ～　やらないんですか？

dialogue_en:
Great job out there!
Got some greens for you, as promised.
dialogue_jp:
ナイスラッシュです！
そんなあなたに　新鮮野菜をプレゼント

dialogue_en: Aw! Better luck next time. Guess I'll be hangin' onto these greens for now.
dialogue_jp:
あら～　バッドラッシュですね～
新鮮野菜は　おあずけで～す

dialogue_en: That was incredible! Took me by surprise.
dialogue_jp: グレートラッシュ　びっくりです！

dialogue_en: Wow! You've got some real talent there.
dialogue_jp:
すごい　お客さん
めちゃくちゃ才能ありますよ！

dialogue_en: Nice one! That was pretty good.
dialogue_jp: ナイスラッシュ　いい感じですね！

dialogue_en: Heh, see if you can do even better next time!
dialogue_jp: 次はもっと　上を目指してみましょう！

dialogue_en: Sorry, but that wasn't nearly up to snuff.
dialogue_jp: ざんね～ん　バッドラッシュです

dialogue_en: Ooh... Looks like someone needs more practice.
dialogue_jp: あら～　もっと練習したほうがいいですね～

dialogue_en: He looks promising.
dialogue_jp: おっ　いいカモ発見～！

dialogue_en: Look who's come waltzin' back!
dialogue_jp: ククク　カモがまた来やがったぜ

dialogue_en: You lost or somethin'?
dialogue_jp: なんだ　迷子か？

dialogue_en: What? Got a problem?
dialogue_jp: 文句でもあんのか？

dialogue_en: Oh, am I holding you up?
dialogue_jp: おら　新人は前を歩け

dialogue_en: We're just goin' for a little stroll. Ain't that right?
dialogue_jp: 俺たちは　散歩してるだけだよな？

dialogue_en: We're all good friends here!
dialogue_jp: へっへっへ　こいつらはお友達さ

dialogue_en: Don't mind us. We ain't doin' nothin'.
dialogue_jp: 俺たちのことは　気にすんなって

dialogue_en: Hahaha!
dialogue_jp: へっへっへっへ

dialogue_en: Hih hih hih...
dialogue_jp: クククク……

dialogue_en: Heheh...
dialogue_jp: いひひひ！

dialogue_en: Hahaha!
dialogue_jp: ひゃひゃひゃ！

dialogue_en: Heh heh heh...
dialogue_jp: ふふふふ……

dialogue_en: Allow us to show you how things work around here.
dialogue_jp: プリズンの流儀を教えてやらねえとな

dialogue_en: Aw, come on. I don't bite.
dialogue_jp: 怖がんなよ　俺と遊ぼうぜ

dialogue_en: I ain't gonna hurt ya. Promise.
dialogue_jp: 悪いようにはしねえからよ

dialogue_en: Sorry, but you're stuck with me now.
dialogue_jp: 俺は　しつこいぜ～

dialogue_en: You ain't gettin' away.
dialogue_jp: 逃がさねえよ

dialogue_en: Whatcha goin' that way for, man?
dialogue_jp: そっちじゃねえだろ～？

dialogue_en: Where d'you think you're goin'?
dialogue_jp: どこ行くつもりだ～？

dialogue_en: Nothin' interestin' over there.
dialogue_jp: そっちに用はねえぞ

dialogue_en: Let's go somewhere more quiet.
dialogue_jp: 人気のないとこへ行こうぜ

dialogue_en: Yeah, that's the way.
dialogue_jp: いいぞ　そっちだ

dialogue_en: Uh-huh, keep goin'.
dialogue_jp: そうだ　その先だ

dialogue_en: Hehehe... Not far now.
dialogue_jp: ククク　もうすぐだ

dialogue_en: You got it. Just straight ahead.
dialogue_jp: ほ～ら　そのまま進め

dialogue_en: Dammit! He got away.
dialogue_jp: チッ　逃げやがった

dialogue_en: Shit. Guess I'll wait here.
dialogue_jp: クソ　ここで待つか

dialogue_en: Don't think this means you're free to go.
dialogue_jp: 逃げられると思うなよ

dialogue_en: Look who's back.
dialogue_jp: 戻ってきたな

dialogue_en: It's about time.
dialogue_jp: 待ってたぜ

dialogue_en: Let's resume our "constitutional."
dialogue_jp: さて　お散歩の再開だ

dialogue_en: And here we are!
dialogue_jp: とうちゃ～く！

dialogue_en:
Now we can have a nice, private talk
without anyone buttin' in.
dialogue_jp:
ここまで来れば
邪魔されずに　好き放題できるってワケよ

dialogue_en: Right!?
dialogue_jp: なあ！

dialogue_en: It's time you got a lesson in the way things work around here. Don't worry, you can thank us later!
dialogue_jp:
俺たちが　プリズンの流儀を教えてやるからよ
ありがたく思うんだな

dialogue_en:
Y'know, you coulda just told us
you were out of our league!
dialogue_jp:
もう　強いんだったら
最初に言ってくださいよ～

dialogue_en:
I mean, uh...thanks for the match!
It was a real learnin' experience.
dialogue_jp:
いや～　こんな強い方と
お手合わせできて光栄だな～！

dialogue_en: Wasn't it, boys?
dialogue_jp: なあ　おまえら！

dialogue_en:
Oh, right! We got somethin' special for ya.
A gift to remember us by. Here!
dialogue_jp:
そうだ　よかったら　これ……
お近づきのしるしに　どうぞ！

dialogue_en:
And with that...
We'll hurry up and get out of your hair.
dialogue_jp:
それじゃあ　目ざわりな俺たちは
すぐに消えますんで

dialogue_en: Right, boys!?
dialogue_jp: なあ　おまえら！

dialogue_en: Very sorry to have troubled ya. We won't do it again! Promise!
dialogue_jp: このたびは　本当にすいませんでした～！

dialogue_en: Greetings, friends, and welcome to my swindling seminar.
dialogue_jp:
みなさん
詐欺師育成セミナーへようこそ

dialogue_en: Today, for the very first time, I'll be unveiling the art behind the con─teaching you the tricks of my trade.
dialogue_jp:
本日は　私が培ってきましたノウハウを
包み隠さず　すべてお教えします

dialogue_en:
Gone are the days of getting duped!
Remove the wool over your eyes.
dialogue_jp:
だまされる人生はここまで
みなさんは　生まれ変わるのです

dialogue_en: And instead, join me in the fleecing!
dialogue_jp:
いっしょに
立派な詐欺師になりましょう

dialogue_en: Let's get right to the heart of skillful swindling.
dialogue_jp:
詐欺師に大切なことがなにか
わかりますか？

dialogue_en: The key is to never tell the truth.
dialogue_jp: もちろん　嘘をつくことです

dialogue_en: This may sound easy to some, but do not be fooled.
dialogue_jp:
嘘をつくぐらい
簡単だと思われるかもしれません

dialogue_en: There is a depth to the art of deception. It is a skill you must hone.
dialogue_jp:
ところが　嘘とは実に奥深く
繊細なものなのです

dialogue_en: And what better way to learn than a little practical application?
dialogue_jp:
そのことを　みなさんに
体験してもらおうと思います

dialogue_en: Now then, let us begin the exercise.
dialogue_jp: では　さっそく嘘をついてみましょう

dialogue_en: Ideally, I would ask a passerby to tell truth from falsehood...
dialogue_jp:
せっかくなら　どなたかに
嘘を見破ってもらいたいのですが……

dialogue_en: You, sir, have excellent timing.
dialogue_jp: あなた　いいところに来ました！

dialogue_en:
I'm conducting a seminar
and would appreciate your help.
dialogue_jp:
我が　詐欺師育成セミナーの
お手伝いをしませんか？

dialogue_en: And as thanks for your assistance, rest assured you will be handsomely rewarded.
dialogue_jp:
もちろん　タダとは言いません
とても貴重なプレゼントを差し上げますよ

dialogue_en: All you need to do is speak with my lovely pupils here.
dialogue_jp:
これから　受講生のみなさんに
話しかけてください

dialogue_en:
Four of these folks are lying,
while one and only one is telling the truth.
dialogue_jp:
４人の嘘つきの中に
１人の『正直者』が混ざっています

dialogue_en: Your job is to find the odd one out!
dialogue_jp: その正直者を当ててください

dialogue_en:
There's also a small fee to participate,
but I'm sure you won't mind.
dialogue_jp:
挑戦する際には手数料が掛かりますので
ご了承ください

dialogue_en: If you're looking for a place to get loaded, then look no further than Bail Jumper! It's the only bar that serves Cosmo Canyons!
dialogue_jp:
プリズンの酒場といえば　ベイル・ジャンパー！
『コスモキャニオン』が飲めるのは　あそこだけさ

dialogue_en: Hey, you ever heard of a place called Bail Jumper? Got the finest booze around─pure as the driven snow! Not watered down one bit!
dialogue_jp:
酒場のベイル・ジャンパーって知ってるか？
混じりっけなしの高級酒を提供してくれるぜ

dialogue_en: You oughta drop by Bail Jumper sometime. Their house specialty─"Sunshine"─is like nothing you've ever tasted. Promise!
dialogue_jp:
ベイル・ジャンパーっていう酒場に行ってみな
名物の『ウスザケ』が　やみつきになるぜ～

dialogue_en: You know, the bars around here serve drinks so watered down that you can go for hours on end and still not feel it!
dialogue_jp:
プリズンの酒場はいいぜえ
ウス～い酒が　たらふく飲めるからよ

dialogue_en: Heh heh heh...
dialogue_jp: うへへへ……

dialogue_en: Heh heh heh...
dialogue_jp: うへへへ……

dialogue_en: You got a problem?
dialogue_jp: ああ～？

dialogue_en: Was it something I said?
dialogue_jp: ああ～？

dialogue_en: Heh, you seem like a guy who can hold his liquor. That's our house specialty─call it "Sunshine."
dialogue_jp:
おっ　いい飲みっぷりだね～
そいつは当店の名物『ウスザケ』よ

dialogue_en: We take moonshine and water it down so the flavor's juuust still perceptible.
dialogue_jp: 限界までウスめられた　奥深い味が最高だろ？

dialogue_en: You're hittin' that stuff pretty hard. Good thing it ain't too strong.
dialogue_jp: 自慢の『ウスザケ』　結構イケるだろ

dialogue_en: It may be diluted, but it's got a refined taste.
dialogue_jp: うちの酒は　ウスくてうまいだろ？

dialogue_en: The weapon store owner's got a few screws loose if you ask me. I mean, what's he doing selling potions of all things?
dialogue_jp:
武器屋の店長　ああ見えて意外とドジなんだよね
だって　間違って『ポーション』を売ってるのよ

dialogue_en:
You been to the weapon shop?
It's ridiculously loud in there.
dialogue_jp:
武器屋には行った？
騒がしい店だったでしょ

dialogue_en:
I like it though─helps me relax.
Plus, they sell potions there too.
dialogue_jp:
『ポーション』も売ってるから
私は癒やされたいときに行くの

dialogue_en: No talking allowed in the local weapon shop.
dialogue_jp: プリズンの武器屋は　私語厳禁

dialogue_en: And that includes any shouts of surprise when you find out they sell elixirs too.
dialogue_jp:
なぜか『エリクサー』が売ってるけど
びっくりして　物音を立てないようにね

dialogue_en: I gasped when I found out the weapon shop sold elixirs, which immediately got me kicked out for making noise.
dialogue_jp:
武器屋に『エリクサー』が売ってたから
驚いて声をあげたの　そしたら怒られちまった

dialogue_en: Hah...
dialogue_jp: ふん……

dialogue_en: Hey, keep it movin'!
dialogue_jp: ふわ～……

dialogue_en: I'm dying to read Gus's autobiography, Meditations on the Outlaw Life, but the bookstore still doesn't have it in stock.
dialogue_jp:
『孤独のアウトロー』が読みたいのによ
魔導書店に置いてねえんだよな

dialogue_en:
Ya gotta check out Garth's autobiography, Meditations on the Underling Life.
It's at the local bookstore.
dialogue_jp:
魔導書店に　ブラザー・ガスの自伝
『舎弟のアウトロー』が入荷したんだってよ

dialogue_en: Have you read Gus's autobiography Meditations on the Outlaw Life yet? You can pick it up at the local bookstore. I definitely recommend it.
dialogue_jp:
ゲス様の自伝『孤独のアウトロー』は読んだか？
魔導書店に置いてあるから　覗いてみるんだな

dialogue_en: You need to get yourself over to the local bookstore to nab a copy of Gus's autobiography, Meditations on the Outlaw Life. It's a must read, trust me!
dialogue_jp:
魔導書店に置いてあるロンリー・ゲス様の自伝
『孤独のアウトロー』は読んどいたほうがいいぜ

dialogue_en: Ahahaha!
dialogue_jp: フヒャハッハ！

dialogue_en: Woo!
dialogue_jp: フォー！

dialogue_en: Oh, you have an eye for fine literature. That's the first volume of Solemn Gus's best-selling autobiography, Meditations on the Outlaw Life.
dialogue_jp:
おっと　お目が高い　そちらはいま話題の１冊
ロンリー・ゲス様の自伝『孤独のアウトロー』です

dialogue_en: It's the tale of a lonely little boy who dreamed of running his very own prison.
dialogue_jp:
孤独だったゲス少年が　なりあがり
プリズンを支配するまでのサクセスストーリー

dialogue_en: Like the tagline says, "There's a bit of Gus in all of us!"
dialogue_jp:
キャッチコピーは
ゲスで上等　笑って生きろ！

dialogue_en: You'd be a fool to miss this chance to partake of Gus's wisdom. By the time you've read to the end, you'll see the world in a whole new light.
dialogue_jp:
読み終わると　前向きになる素晴らしい１冊ですよ
ぜひ　波乱万丈な人生を追体験してみてください

dialogue_en: Solemn Gus's Meditations on the Outlaw Life paints a thrilling portrait of the criminal underworld.
dialogue_jp:
ゲス様が書かれた『孤独のアウトロー』は
グリードの歴史書としても　オススメですよ！

dialogue_en: Maybe his inspiring tale will motivate you to become an entrepreneurial hoodlum as well! Who knows?
dialogue_jp:
あなたも『孤独のアウトロー』を読んで
破天荒な男になってみませんか～？

dialogue_en: Gus's crib is covered in graffiti─like some kinda art museum. My personal favorite is this adorable del Sol cactuar!
dialogue_jp:
ゲス様の屋敷ってラクガキだらけで可愛いでしょ？
特に『ハッピーテンダー』がキュートなんだよね～

dialogue_en: You checked out the graffiti at Gus's place? He's got a del Sol cactuar in there. See if you can find it.
dialogue_jp:
ゲス様の屋敷のグラフィティは見た？
『ハッピーテンダー』が隠れてるから探してみて

dialogue_en: It's kinda weird, but Gus has a picture of Stamp on his wall.
dialogue_jp:
ゲス様の屋敷の壁には
『忠犬スタンプ』が描いてあるの

dialogue_en: I swear, it looks like it could jump out and start licking your face!
dialogue_jp: 躍動感があって　すごく可愛らしいんだよね

dialogue_en: Hey, did you see the Stamp graffiti over at Gus's crib?
dialogue_jp:
ゲス様の屋敷に描いてある
『忠犬スタンプ』　見た？

dialogue_en: He may be a pup, but he sure looks like a hero!
dialogue_jp: 可愛くて　いまにも飛び出してきそうだったでしょ

dialogue_en: Hahaha!
dialogue_jp: えへへ

dialogue_en: Uh-huh...
dialogue_jp: うふふふ

dialogue_en: You should test your might in the Beast Battleground. They've got a rare monster named Bug 0.
dialogue_jp:
ビーストバトルグラウンドに挑戦してみな
『バグ０』って　レアなモンスターに会えるぜ

dialogue_en: Have you tried the Beast Battleground yet? I hear that Type-0 monster's a real toughie.
dialogue_jp:
ビーストバトルグラウンドに行ってみたか？
『カロリー０』ってモンスターが強いんだよな

dialogue_en: Dunno if you've heard, but there's a special monster named Test 0 in the Beast Battleground.
dialogue_jp:
地下にあるビーストバトルグラウンドには
『テスト０』って名前のモンスターがいるんだと

dialogue_en: If you visit the Beast Battleground, you might just run into a rare monster named Test 0.
dialogue_jp:
ビーストバトルグラウンドに出れば
『テスト０』っていうレアモンスターと戦えるぜ

dialogue_en: Heh heh...
dialogue_jp: ふふ～ん

dialogue_en: Heh heh...
dialogue_jp: うっへへへー！

dialogue_en: Well? Do you think you can figure out who's telling the truth?
dialogue_jp: どなたが正直者か　わかりましたか？

dialogue_en: Do you know who is telling the truth?
dialogue_jp: どなたが正直者か　わかりましたか？

dialogue_en: Yes
dialogue_jp: はい

dialogue_en: No
dialogue_jp: いいえ

dialogue_en: Hm? Sorry, friend, but you don't have enough gil. Money makes the world go round, you know─come back when you've got some.
dialogue_jp:
手数料が足りませんね
何事にもお金は必要です　出直してください

dialogue_en: The truth is out there, as they say. I encourage you to walk around town and find it.
dialogue_jp: 嘘か真実か　街を調べて確認されてもいいですよ

dialogue_en: <button=RS> Who is Telling the Truth?
dialogue_jp: <button=RS> 正直者を選ぼう

dialogue_en: Thirsty Usain
dialogue_jp: 酒浸りのウサン

dialogue_en: Knucklehead Toya
dialogue_jp: 百戦錬磨のトロイ

dialogue_en: Sloppy Shawn
dialogue_jp: 悪書家のソウ

dialogue_en: Squinty Rachel
dialogue_jp: 近視眼のラホ

dialogue_en: Blowhard Georgie
dialogue_jp: 大言壮語のキョギ

dialogue_en: Oh, too bad! I'm afraid you've been had.
dialogue_jp: う～ん残念　不正解です！

dialogue_en:
My pupils have a knack for the art of deception.
Well done!
dialogue_jp:
みなさん　嘘がお上手ですねえ
すばらしい！

dialogue_en: Discerning the truth is a skill, just like telling a lie. Now then, what say we take it from the top and have you try again?
dialogue_jp:
では　シャッフルして　もういちどやりましょう
今度こそ　しっかりと見極めてくださいね

dialogue_en:
You've been hoodwinked once again!
Better luck next time, friend.
dialogue_jp:
またまた不正解
はい　やり直し！

dialogue_en: Congratulations! Their deception was no match for your powers of perception!
dialogue_jp:
大正解です
なんという洞察力　すばらしい！

dialogue_en: Beware, my aspiring swindlers: clever ones like this are harder to fool.
dialogue_jp:
みなさん　世の中には
こういう鋭い方がいらっしゃるのです

dialogue_en: But so long as you continue to train and apply yourselves, I can teach you to swindle even the toughest marks!
dialogue_jp:
そんな人も　しっかりだませるよう
私といっしょに　勉強していきましょうね

dialogue_en: Yessir!
dialogue_jp: はい！

dialogue_en: As for you─rest assured that I am a man of my word.
dialogue_jp:
では　これは
お約束していた景品です

dialogue_en: Those greens are hard to find in a place like this. Quite the handsome reward, wouldn't you say?
dialogue_jp:
砂漠で野菜は貴重品
嘘はついてないですよね？

dialogue_en: My dear pupils, are you familiar with the phrase "the best lies are told in truths"?
dialogue_jp:
みなさん『嘘を隠すなら真実の中』
という言葉をご存知でしょうか？

dialogue_en: The trick to deceiving someone is to pad your fiction with facts.
dialogue_jp:
嘘を　うまくつくコツは
真実に混ぜることです

dialogue_en: Learn to couch your lies among statements that are true, and you'll be a super-swindler!
dialogue_jp:
その　ブレンドテクニックこそが
詐欺師の極意と言っていいでしょう

dialogue_en: And as luck would have it, I've brought with me a guidebook that details how to master this art─which I'm offering today at a special low price!
dialogue_jp:
その極意がすべて書かれている指南書を
なんと　本日は格安で販売いたします！

dialogue_en: My friends, I'm so proud of all the progress you've made.
dialogue_jp:
みなさん
いい顔つきになってきましたね

dialogue_en: That devious look in your eyes tells me you're hungry for more knowledge.
dialogue_jp:
隙のない眼差し
すっかり詐欺師の顔です

dialogue_en: Perhaps it's time we move on to some more advanced lessons.
dialogue_jp:
そろそろ
上級者コースに進むときですね

dialogue_en: The tuition is a bit steeper than before, but do not let that deter you.
dialogue_jp:
受講料はすこしだけ高くなりますが
ご安心ください

dialogue_en: You'll make it all back and more once you become a pro like me.
dialogue_jp: 詐欺師になれば　すぐに取り戻せますよ

dialogue_en: My friends, I presume you've seen the broadcast out of Wutai.
dialogue_jp:
みなさん
ウータイの映像はご覧になりましたか

dialogue_en: So shocking. I could scarce believe my eyes and ears.
dialogue_jp: 私はあれを見て　心底感嘆いたしました

dialogue_en: The way they twisted words and visuals, interweaving fact with fiction...
dialogue_jp:
嘘と真実の混ぜ方
話術とボディランゲージ

dialogue_en: It was a master class in deception!
dialogue_jp: どれをとっても一級品です！

dialogue_en: As it happens, I managed to procure a recording of the broadcast.
dialogue_jp:
実は特別に
録画映像を入手しましたので

dialogue_en: And I'm offering copies to you at a very special pupil discount!
dialogue_jp:
みなさんに格別のお値段で
お譲りしたいと考えています

dialogue_en: Got a lust for blood? Then you've come to the right place!
dialogue_jp: 血に飢えたツワモノたちよ　よく来たな

dialogue_en: All our most ferocious fiends are champing at the bit!
dialogue_jp:
選りすぐりのモンスターをそろえて
待っていたぞ！

dialogue_en: In the ring, it's man versus monster.
dialogue_jp: リングにあがれば　邪魔者はいない

dialogue_en: No one to save you from a grisly demise but yourself!
dialogue_jp: 生きるも死ぬも　おまえ次第！

dialogue_en: Think you can walk on the wild side and live to tell the tale?
dialogue_jp:
さあ　スリルに身をゆだねる準備は
できたか？

dialogue_en: Then step into the battleground and unleash the beast within!
dialogue_jp: クールで熱いバトルを見せてくれ！

dialogue_en: Welcome to Beast Battleground!
dialogue_jp: ビーストバトルグラウンドへ　ようこそ

dialogue_en: So─you lookin' for a thrill you won't find anywhere up top?
dialogue_jp:
上では味わえない
刺激的な遊びを体験してみるか？

dialogue_en: Defeat a few fiends and there could be some fresh new greens in it for ya!
dialogue_jp:
モンスターとのバトルに勝てば
新鮮野菜がもらえるぜ？

dialogue_en: Whew! Look at you go.
dialogue_jp: ヒュ～　やるじゃねえか

dialogue_en: Be sure to check out some of our other contests too, if you're in the market for a little danger.
dialogue_jp:
ほかにもデンジャラスなイベントをやってるからよ
気が向いたら　また寄ってくれ

dialogue_en: No need to say a word. I already know your story. You're on the hunt for chocobo greens, am I right?
dialogue_jp:
話は聞いてるよ　なんでも屋くん
きみ　野菜を探してるんだって？

dialogue_en: Well...I'd be willing to scratch your back─provided you'd be willing to scratch mine.
dialogue_jp:
そこでだ　野菜を分けるかわりに
ひとつ仕事を引き受けてくれないか？

dialogue_en: No need to say a word. I already know your story. In fact, I've got a very special job with your name on it.
dialogue_jp:
話は聞いてるよ　なんでも屋くん
実は　きみに頼みたい仕事があるんだ

dialogue_en: My casino happens to be plagued by a gaggle of rather...eccentric Queen's Blood players.
dialogue_jp:
私が仕切っている広場のカジノに
風変わりなカードバウターたちが居座っていてね

dialogue_en: I'd love it if someone could take them down a notch or two. So, think you're up to the task?
dialogue_jp:
彼らを倒してもらいたいんだ
どうだろう　やってくれるかい？

dialogue_en: I'll handle it.
dialogue_jp: 引き受けよう

dialogue_en: Much obliged.
dialogue_jp: 助かる

dialogue_en: Outlandish though they are, they play a mean game─so mean that it's scaring away my clientele.
dialogue_jp:
変わった連中だが　腕は立つみたいでね
挑戦者が減ってしまって　困っていたんだ

dialogue_en:
I need someone to get out there
and prove they can be beaten.
dialogue_jp: いちどでも勝ってみせれば　また盛りあがるだろう

dialogue_en:
Got three troublemakers in total.
Still looking for action, no doubt.
dialogue_jp:
カードバウターは３人
広場のカジノにいるはずだ

dialogue_en: Thanks in advance.
dialogue_jp: よろしく頼むよ

dialogue_en:
Before you go though, you should take a look
at the cards I have for sale. I guarantee they'll
come in handy.
dialogue_jp:
それじゃあ　うちのカードを見ていってくれ
カードバウトの役に立つかもしれない

dialogue_en: No need to say a word. I know your story.
dialogue_jp: 話は聞いたよ　なんでも屋くん

dialogue_en: I also happen to know that you've racked up a few QB wins at the casino.
dialogue_jp:
きみ　カジノにいたカードバウターを
倒してくれたんだって？

dialogue_en: As its owner, allow me to express my gratitude. Some players have no restraint.
dialogue_jp:
私は　カジノを仕切っていてね
連中には手を焼いていたんだ

dialogue_en: Incidentally, there are three troublemakers in total. You'd be doing me a favor if you were to beat them all.
dialogue_jp:
カードバウターは全員で３人
その調子で　残りも倒してもらえると助かる

dialogue_en: Here's an idea: do it and I'll give you some greens in exchange. Sound like a deal?
dialogue_jp:
そうだな　報酬は野菜でどうかな？
よろしく頼むよ

dialogue_en: There are three troublemakers in total, actually. If you were to beat them all, I'd be quite grateful.
dialogue_jp:
カードバウターは全員で３人
その調子で　残りも倒してもらえると助かる

dialogue_en: Thanks in advance.
dialogue_jp: よろしく頼むよ

dialogue_en: Before you go, though, you should take a look at the cards I have for sale. I guarantee they'll come in handy.
dialogue_jp:
それじゃあ　うちのカードを見ていってくれ
カードバウトの役に立つかもしれない

dialogue_en:
You did me a great favor.
Take this as a token of my thanks.
dialogue_jp:
助かったよ　これは礼だ
受け取ってくれ

dialogue_en: Before you go, though, I have some cards I'd highly recommend for a player as skilled as yourself.
dialogue_jp:
そうだ　きみのような凄腕バウターに
オススメのカードがあるんだ

dialogue_en: You won't want to miss out.
dialogue_jp: ぜひ　見ていってくれ

dialogue_en: And there's the man of the hour.
dialogue_jp: 来たね　なんでも屋くん

dialogue_en: Thanks to your efforts...
dialogue_jp: きみが勝ってくれたおかげで

dialogue_en: demand for Queen's Blood is back and stronger than ever. It's at an all-time high!
dialogue_jp:
下火になっていたクイーンズ・ブラッドに
また　火がついたよ

dialogue_en: Which means my profits should be too.
dialogue_jp: これで　しばらくは稼げそうだ

dialogue_en:
You did me a great favor.
Take this as a token of my thanks.
dialogue_jp:
助かったよ　これは礼だ
受け取ってくれ

dialogue_en: Before you go, though, I have some cards I'd highly recommend for a player as skilled as yourself.
dialogue_jp:
そうだ　きみのような凄腕バウターに
オススメのカードがあるんだ

dialogue_en: You won't want to miss out.
dialogue_jp: ぜひ　見ていってくれ

dialogue_en: Only cards of the highest quality, guaranteed. Browse as long as you like.
dialogue_jp:
どれも自慢のカードたちだ
じっくり見ていってくれ

dialogue_en: How are your QB games going?
dialogue_jp: カードバウトの調子はどうだい？

dialogue_en: Did you see Wutai's broadcast? Sounds like things are about to get very interesting. Personally, I can't wait.
dialogue_jp:
ウータイの放送は見た？
久しぶりに場が動きそうだ　面白くなってきた

dialogue_en: Remember: I'm still counting on you to get that job done.
dialogue_jp: 依頼している仕事のほうも　しっかり頼むよ

dialogue_en: Have you managed to beat any of those Queen's Blood players yet?
dialogue_jp:
カジノにいるカードバウターたちは
倒してくれたかな？

dialogue_en: People lose interest when they start thinking they can't win. That's why it's important to shake things up once in a while.
dialogue_jp:
強すぎる者がいると　場が硬直してしまう
たまには負けてもらわないとね

dialogue_en: By the way, don't breathe a word about this to the folks upstairs...unless you want to find yourself behind bars again.
dialogue_jp:
それと　くれぐれもカジノのことは上に漏らすなよ
牢獄暮らしはゴメンだろ？

dialogue_en: I wouldn't mind you stoking more interest in Queen's Blood, if you're ever in the mood.
dialogue_jp:
気が向いたら　またクイーンズ・ブラッドを
盛りあげてってくれ

dialogue_en: Feel free to win, but don't let it get out of hand.
dialogue_jp: うちのカジノでは　勝ちすぎないでくれよ

dialogue_en:
Welcome to Bail Jumper, watering hole
for the dregs of the Dustbowl.
dialogue_jp:
飲んだくれの酒場
ベイル・ジャンパーへようこそ

dialogue_en: Heard you're in the market for some greens.
dialogue_jp: あんた　野菜が欲しいんだって？

dialogue_en: Maybe.
dialogue_jp: ああ

dialogue_en:
If so, I've got a garden up on the cliff.
Everything's yours for the taking.
dialogue_jp:
なら　崖の上に畑があるからよ
勝手にとってっていいぞ

dialogue_en: Assuming there's anything to take. Haven't tended to it in ages. Here, go see for yourself.
dialogue_jp:
ずっとほったらかしだが　なんかあるだろ
ほら　これで行けるからよ

dialogue_en:
Be sure to keep an eye out for fiends, though.
Place is crawling with 'em.
dialogue_jp:
ただ　あそこはモンスターが出るからよ
気をつけるんだな

dialogue_en: Found the one place around here that had a spot of green, but the road there's so rough, I stopped goin'.
dialogue_jp:
日当たりがいいところに畑を作ったものの
道が険しすぎてな　ほったらかしよ

dialogue_en: Haven't tended to those plants in ages, but I'm sure something's still alive.
dialogue_jp:
ずっと　放置しちまってるが
すこしは生き残ってんだろ

dialogue_en: I'll wait right here─leave the green huntin' to you. Wouldn't wanna get in the way.
dialogue_jp:
邪魔になるから　ぼくはここで待ってるよ
野菜　頼んだよ

dialogue_en:
Goin' for more?
Well, be here if you need me.
dialogue_jp:
また行くの？
じゃあ　ここで待ってるね

dialogue_en: Didn't find nothin'?
dialogue_jp: 野菜　なかったの？

dialogue_en: Got your hands on some greens, huh?
dialogue_jp: 野菜　手に入ったみたいだね！

dialogue_en: Howdy.
dialogue_jp: おかえり

dialogue_en: Got those greens you were after? Well, good. Guess my hands-off farming method works better than I thought.
dialogue_jp:
野菜は手に入ったか　そうか……
ほったらかし農業　案外イケるもんだな

dialogue_en: Here to wet your whistle? I can fix you a drink if you like.
dialogue_jp:
１杯やってくか？
味の保証はしねえがな

dialogue_en: Just don't go complainin' that it tastes "weak"─it's delicate.
dialogue_jp: ウスいって文句言いやがったら　ぶん殴るからな

dialogue_en: Been watering down the drinks less, what with the news outta Wutai.
dialogue_jp:
ウータイのことがあって
酒をちょっと　濃くしたんだ

dialogue_en: Can't deal with that shit sober.
dialogue_jp: 酔えるうちに　酔っとかねえとな
